title: Classic Red Lentil Dal (Masoor Dal)
description: A comforting Indian lentil dish featuring soft, creamy lentils flavored with aromatic spices and finished with a fragrant oil-based tempering (tadka). Perfect for serving with rice or flatbread.

Lentil Preparation.text: Rinse lentils thoroughly until water runs clear
Combine lentils, 3 cups water, and 1/4 teaspoon turmeric in pot
Bring to boil, then reduce to simmer
Cook 15-20 minutes until lentils are very soft and mushy
Do not drain - dal should have a soupy consistency

Tadka (Tempering).text: Heat oil or ghee in a small pan over medium heat
Add hing, let sizzle for 5 seconds
Add cumin seeds, let sizzle until fragrant
Add onions, cook until golden brown
Add garlic and ginger, saut√© for 1 minute
Add tomatoes, remaining turmeric, and red chili powder
Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil starts to separate

Final Steps.text: Pour tadka into the cooked dal
Garnish with chopped cilantro and lemon juice

notes: Consistency should be like a thick soup - not watery but definitely not dry
Add hot water if too thick, or simmer longer if too thin
Hing (asafoetida) helps with digestion and adds authentic flavor
Don't skip the final simmer after adding tadka - it helps meld flavors
storage: Can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days
Reheat gently on stovetop or microwave, adding water if needed to adjust consistency
